projectPurpose: To provide a versatile and feature-rich open-source application for digital note-taking, sketching, and document annotation, particularly optimized for use with styluses and drawing tablets.
mainFeatures: Adaptive UI focused on stylus input
Pressure-sensitive stylus input with configurable stroke styles
Different document expansion layouts (fixed, continuous, infinite)
Customizable backgrounds, patterns, sizes, and page format
PDF, Bitmap, and SVG image import
Export to SVG, PDF, Xopp, PNG, and JPEG

alternatives.name: Xournal++
mainFeatures: Different drawing tools and stroke styles

alternatives.name: Notability
mainFeatures: Audio recording and sync with notes

alternatives.name: Microsoft OneNote
alternatives.license: Proprietary (Free with most features, Microsoft 365 subscription for full benefits)

marketPositioning: Rnote is positioned as a free and open-source alternative in the digital note-taking and sketching market. It differentiates itself by focusing on a robust, vector-based inking experience optimized for stylus input across multiple desktop platforms (Linux, macOS, Windows). While lacking some advanced features found in proprietary competitors like comprehensive OCR, audio sync, or extensive cloud ecosystems, rnote appeals to users who prioritize open-source software, customization, and a dedicated drawing/inking tool with flexible canvas options, offering a compelling choice outside the dominant commercial offerings.
